data.title: What was the capital city of the Persian Empire?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 6): Depends on the empire in question.


Achaemenid Empire (endonym: Xšāça ‘Empire’) (550-330 BCE) [1] had multiple capitals during its existence, with rarely a single capital at any given time. Haxāmaniš, the apical ancestor of the Achaemenid dynasty ruled from Anshan [2], modern Ta...
